submission:
class Solution:
    def minChanges(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> int:
        
        arr = []
        p1 = 0
        p2 = len(nums) - 1
        while p1 < p2:
            arr.append(abs(nums[p2] - nums[p1]))
            p1 += 1
            p2 -= 1
        
        print(arr)
        res = float('inf')
        d = {}
        for i in arr:
            if i not in d: d[i] = 0
            d[i] += 1
        
        n = len(nums)
        p = len(arr)
        keys = [(d[i], i) for i in d]
        keys.sort(reverse = True)
        for z, i in keys:
            f = 0
            temp = 0
            for j in range(p):
                if arr[j] == i: continue
                if max(nums[j], nums[n - j - 1]) < i and min(nums[j], nums[n - j - 1]) + i > k:
                    temp += 2
                    f = 1
                else:
                    temp += 1
            res = min(res, temp)
            if f == 0: break
            
        
        return res
